Package uk.co.spudsoft.xlsx

Class TableDefinition

java.lang.Object
uk.co.spudsoft.xlsx.TableDefinition
public class TableDefinition extends Object
Definition of all formatting to be applied to the table. It would be possible to create a more flexible API for formatting, but this should be adequate for producing a nicely formatted 'feed' type workbook.
Author:
jtalbut

    Description
    TableDefinition(String application, String name, String creator, boolean gridLines, boolean headers, FontDefinition headerFont, FontDefinition bodyFont, ColourDefinition headerColours, ColourDefinition evenColours, ColourDefinition oddColours, List<ColumnDefinition> columns)

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

  • Field Details

    • application

      public final String application
      The application that is reported in the document properties. If null the value XlsxWriter.DEFAULT_APP_NAME is used.

    • name

      public final String name
      The name of the worksheet in the workbook. If null the value "Sheet1" is used.

    • creator

      public final String creator
      The name of the user creating the workbook as reported in the document properties. If null the value XlsxWriter.DEFAULT_APP_NAME is used.

    • gridLines

      public final boolean gridLines
      If set to true a 'thin' (Excel's terminology) border will be applied to each cell output.

    • headers

      public final boolean headers
      If set to true a header row containing the names of each column will be generated.

    • headerFont

      public final FontDefinition headerFont
      The font to use for the header row (if headers are enabled). If headers are not enabled this value is ignored. If this value is not specified the default value is Calibri 11pt.

    • bodyFont

      public final FontDefinition bodyFont
      The font to use for every row after the header row. If this value is not specified the default value is Calibri 11pt.

    • headerColours

      public final ColourDefinition headerColours
      The foreground (font) and background (fill) colours to use for the header row. If headers are not enabled this value is ignored.

    • evenColours

      public final ColourDefinition evenColours
      The foreground (font) and background (fill) colours to use for every even numbered row.

    • oddColours

      public final ColourDefinition oddColours
      The foreground (font) and background (fill) colours to use for every odd numbered row.

    • columns

      public final List<ColumnDefinition> columns
      Details of the columns in the output. If a row contains more fields than the specified columns the output will accommodate them but they will have no header and no number format.

  • Constructor Details

    • TableDefinition

      public TableDefinition(String application, String name, String creator, boolean gridLines, boolean headers, FontDefinition headerFont, FontDefinition bodyFont, ColourDefinition headerColours, ColourDefinition evenColours, ColourDefinition oddColours, List<ColumnDefinition> columns)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      application - The application that is reported in the document properties.
      name - The name of the worksheet in the workbook.
      creator - The name of the user creating the workbook as reported in the document properties.
      gridLines - If set to true a 'thin' border will be applied to each cell output.
      headers - If set to true a header row containing the names of each column will be generated.
      headerFont - The font to use for the header row.
      bodyFont - The font to use for every row after the header row.
      headerColours - The colours to use for the header row.
      evenColours - The colours to use for every even numbered row.
      oddColours - The colours to use for every odd numbered row.
      columns - Details of the columns in the output.
